Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can draw a basic picture of a string telephone with two students each holding a cup.
The student can partially show the string connecting the two cups and stretching over a distance, though it may not be correctly taut or straight.
CANNOT: The student may not accurately illustrate how the string carries sound from one cup to the other, possibly omitting or incorrectly drawing sound waves *(student doesn't fully understand that sound travels through the string)*.
The student might not clearly depict sound traveling through the string and might miss using lines or arrows to indicate sound waves *(student omits or misdraws arrows)*.
The student might attempt to label parts, but likely forgets or mislabels elements such as the string or cups *(student inconsistently applies labeling)*.

The student may struggle to explain through a caption or labels how people use such devices to communicate over distances, possibly writing incorrect or incomplete explanations *(student doesn't have a full grasp of the practical use of the device)*.
